title.narrative: 005 Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) IN EMERGENCY

description.narrative: Populations affected by Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) emergencies receive Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services in line with minimum standards, which contributes to Disaster Risk Reduction, Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid), Wash And Emergencies, Water, Water (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 'By 2020, the Ethiopian population (including refugees and asylum seekers) in particular women, children, adolescent girls and vulnerable groups, use affordable, safe, reliable, sustainable and adequate water supply, sanitation and appropriate hygiene practices in households, communities and institutions in rural and urban areas

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Populations affected by WASH emergencies receive WASH services in line with minimum standards

description.narrative: In the reporting period, with UNICEF's support 1,103,073 people (including returnees and refugees) affected by emergencies are provided with lifesaving water supply interventions and durable water supply services. About 5,432,820 people were provided with community-based hygiene promotion, while an estimated 441,287 people had access to latrines hand washing facilities. UNICEF WASH continues to offer technical support, alongside nutrition, health and child protection, to joint assessments of quarantine/transit facilities nationwide, coordinated by the Emergency Coordination Center (ECC) in Addis Ababa. The most recent assessment being from June 15-20 visited points of entry and quarantine sites. | Status:Met | As-of Date:24/08/2020

title.narrative: Existence of cluster coordination mechanism for WASH(60958)

actual.value: 2020:•6 federal level during the first quarter of 2020.•32 meetings carried out at the eight regions. The coordination meetings are less than planned due to the restrictions of COVID-19.
